question.text: Consider the molecules <math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> and <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></math> . Which of the given statements is false?

options.text: The H - C - H bond angle in  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></math> , the H - N - H bond angle in  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> , and the H - O - H bond angle in  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></math>  are all greater than  <math><msup><mrow><mn>90</mn></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi></mrow></msup></math> .

The H - O - H bond angle in <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></math> is larger than the H - C - H bond angle in <math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></math> .

The H - O - H bond angle in  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></math>  is smaller than the H - N - H bond angle in  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> .

The H - C - H bond angle in  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></math>  is larger than the H - N - H bond angle in  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> .

solution.text:
Bond Angle Molecule
104.5o H2O
107o NH3
109o28′ CH4
All the molecules are sp3 hybridized and Bond angle of H2O is smaller than NH3 because in H2O two lone pairs are present due to which there will be more lone pair-lone pair repulsion while inNH3,only one lone pair is present, so lone pair-bond pair repulsion is present only.
